title: bst-size
description: Write a function `bst-size` that takes a binary search tree and returns the number of nodes in the tree. An empty tree has size 0.

examples.explanation: A single node tree has size 1
Tree with root and two children has size 3

starterCode:
(define-struct node (left right key))

(define (bst-size t))

(bst-size empty)
(bst-size (make-node empty empty 5))
(bst-size (make-node (make-node empty empty 2) (make-node empty empty 8) 5))
hiddenCases: (check-expect (bst-size (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) (make-node empty empty 3) 2) (make-node (make-node empty empty 6) (make-node empty empty 8) 7) 5)) 7)
(check-expect (bst-size (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) empty 3) empty 7) (make-node empty (make-node empty empty 15) 12) 10)) 6)
(check-expect (bst-size (make-node empty (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 13) empty 17) (make-node empty empty 25) 20) 15)) 5)
(check-expect (bst-size (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node (make-node empty empty 1) empty 4) empty 6) empty 9) (make-node (make-node empty empty 14) (make-node empty empty 18) 16) 12)) 8)
